member.name: T:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticSearchExtensions
member.summary: Adds the WriteTo.ElasticSearch() extension method to .

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticSearchExtensions.ElasticSearch(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.String,System.Uri,System.Int32,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events as documents to an ElasticSearch index. This works great with the Kibana web interface when using the default settings. Make sure to add a template to ElasticSearch like the one found here: https://gist.github.com/mivano/9688328
member.param: The logger configuration.
The index format where the events are send to. It defaults to the logstash index per day format. It uses a String.Format using the DateTime.UtcNow parameter.
The URI to the node where ElasticSearch is running. When null, will fall back to http://localhost:9200
The connection time out in milliseconds. Default value is 5000.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticSearchExtensions.ElasticSearch(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Uri},System.String,System.Int32,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events as documents to an ElasticSearch index. This works great with the Kibana web interface when using the default settings. Make sure to add a template to ElasticSearch like the one found here: https://gist.github.com/mivano/9688328
member.param: The logger configuration.
The node URIs of the Elasticsearch cluster.
The index format where the events are send to. It defaults to the logstash index per day format. It uses a String.Format using the DateTime.UtcNow parameter.
The connection time out in milliseconds. Default value is 5000.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.name: M:Serilog.LoggerConfigurationElasticSearchExtensions.ElasticSearch(Serilog.Configuration.LoggerSinkConfiguration,Elasticsearch.Net.Connection.ConnectionConfiguration,System.String,Serilog.Events.LogEventLevel,System.Int32,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.IFormatProvider)
member.summary: Adds a sink that writes log events as documents to an ElasticSearch index. This works great with the Kibana web interface when using the default settings. Make sure to add a template to ElasticSearch like the one found here: https://gist.github.com/mivano/9688328
member.param: The logger configuration.
The configuration to use for connecting to the Elasticsearch cluster.
The index format where the events are send to. It defaults to the logstash index per day format. It uses a String.Format using the DateTime.UtcNow parameter.
The minimum log event level required in order to write an event to the sink.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.
member.returns: Logger configuration, allowing configuration to continue.

member.summary: Writes log events as documents to ElasticSearch.

member.summary: A reasonable default for the number of events posted in each batch.

member.summary: Default to the Logstash index name format

member.summary: Default connection timeout in milliseconds

member.summary: Construct a sink posting to the specified Elasticsearch cluster.
member.param: Connection configuration to use for connecting to the cluster.
The index name formatter. A string.Format using the DateTime.UtcNow is run over this string.
The maximum number of events to post in a single batch.
The time to wait between checking for event batches.
Supplies culture-specific formatting information, or null.

member.param: The events to emit.
